page.title: 12PLANTS OF ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: The Ashdown Forest provides a variety of habitats from dry heath to wet woodland and bog in which a great number of unusual plants from dwarf gorse and needle furze to sundews, mountain fern and bog orchid all grow within a small geographical location. The areas of typical heath, with shallow infertile soil support both wet and dry heath plants. Dry area plants include common heather, bell heather, European gorse, broom, bracken, saw-wort and common dodder. Wet area plants include purple moor grass, marsh gentian, deer grass, cotton grass, sphagnum moss and liverwort. There are woodland valleys with bug-beam,marsh violet and bog pondweed. In other fertile areas there are forest bilberry,bramble, wood anemone blue-bell and wild strawberry.
